metadata.title: CVE-2022-37035 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in bgpd in FRRouting (FRR) 8.3. Inbgp_notify_send_with_data() and bgp_process_packet() in bgp_packet.c, thereis a possible use-after-free due to a race condition. This could lead toRemote Code Execution or Information Disclosure by sending crafted BGPpackets. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-37035` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 8.1-1ubuntu3
frr-pythontools - 8.1-1ubuntu3
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 8.1-1ubuntu3
frr-snmp - 8.1-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: frr package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1-1ubuntu3').
